techniques.name: 14 Point Cover Drill
techniques.description: Introduces the 14 point cover drill, a comprehensive defensive drill focused on boxing defense techniques including slipping, pulling, and ducking punches. Originating from Erik Paulson's teachings, this drill offers a structured approach to learning and refining defensive movements against various strikes.

strategies.slip_jab: Involves moving the head slightly to the side to evade a jab without dropping guard or losing balance.
strategies.slip_cross: Similar to slipping the jab but in the opposite direction, focusing on minimal movement to avoid overexposure.
strategies.pull_jab: Requires a slight backward movement to make the jab miss while staying in position to counter.
strategies.duck_cross: Entails bending at the knees and slightly turning the shoulder to avoid a cross, setting up for potential counters.

techniques.description: Evading the jab by moving the head slightly to one side, ensuring hands remain up and body balanced.
Similar to slipping the jab, but adjusted to evade a cross, emphasizing the importance of minimal movement.
A backward movement to make the jab miss, with the body and feet ready for immediate counter-attack.
Ducking under the cross with a knee bend and shoulder turn, positioning for a counter while avoiding the strike.

key_points: The 14 point cover drill is an effective method for learning and practicing boxing defense techniques.
Focuses on minimal movement for slipping and pulling to maintain balance and readiness for counters.
Ducking involves a combination of bending and turning, which prepares the fighter for immediate counter-attacks.
This drill provides a foundation that is applicable across multiple combat sports, emphasizing adaptability and quick defensive responses.
